review: Bought this a few weeks ago--I have a prime account, as well as a Netflix account, and thought this would be a great way to condense all my subscription services into one place.WRONG--Netflix is completely useless on this.  Pauses, buffers, declares that I have "no network connection".  This happened FIVE times in the first 7 minutes of an hour-long TV episode.  Apparently, there are some workarounds for this (resetting it to factory settings, etc), but I don't have the time for that.  I can buy a Roku stick for the same exact price--maybe it will work, maybe it won't, but this Fire TV stick certainly does not work for me.

review: Well, we haven't had this long enough to "Love it" but I give it a solid 4 stars because it does what it says with minimal fuss.  We had to let go of our TiVo service (I LOVE TIVO - no one's DVR features are even close to what they offer) because, sob, we don't get any over-the-air channels here!  So, we rely on Netflix and Amazon Prime for our TV and Movie watching fixes.  Except...we spaced the fact that our Roamio was WIRELESS and we have no way to connect our TV to the internet anymore for streaming.  In rides the utterly inexpensive Fire TV Stick, which we plugged in and POOF, like magic, we were again connected to the internet.We've played a little bit with the app for our iPads and iPhones, and all seems to work fine.  Our only complaint is that we wish it had a volume control, which I understand you can get with the upgraded remote.  Not worth it for us for that, but otherwise, it's perfect so far.  Once we've had it longer, I may come back and upgrade to 5 stars.
